title: Georgia Rules Meeting 2026 - Day 10 AM Session
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia Rules Meeting 2026 - Day 10 AM Session:

## Overview
The session focused on discussion and consideration of several bills, including HB 350, HB 522, and HB 676. There was some debate around the merits and rationale for the bills, particularly HB 522 which dealt with COVID-19 vaccination status and organ transplant decisions.

## Key Actions
**HB 350**: Bill dealing with pre- and post-exposure medication for HIV, with limitations on pharmacist protocol and physician involvement.
**HB 522**: Bill prohibiting the use of COVID-19 vaccination status as the sole factor in denying a patient placement on an organ transplant list.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced during this session.

## Notable Moments
- Discussion around HB 522 and whether it appropriately balances medical professionals' expertise versus political factors around COVID-19 vaccination.
- Acknowledgment that HB 350 was carried over from the previous year's session.

## Votes
No recorded votes were taken during this session.

## Attendance
A quorum was present, though some members were delayed due to inclement weather.

## Adjournment
The session was adjourned. The next session date was not specified.
